statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: We consider the Fibonacci sequence f where f(0) = 0, f(1) = 1 and f(n) = f(n - 1) + f(n - 2) for n �� 2. For given x(0), one can define another sequence x that x(n) = f(x(n-1)). Now you need to find the minimum n such that x(n) �� x(0) (mod p).

statement.title: Input
statement.content: The first line contains an integer T indicating the number of test cases. Then for each test case, a line consists of two integers x(0) and p where 0 �� x(0) �� $10^9$ and 1 �� p �� 200000.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test, output the minimum n in a line, or -1 if it is impossible.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
3
3
-1
1
1

Hint

In the first case, x(0) = 6 �� 2 (mod 4), x(1) = f(6) = 8 �� 0 (mod 4) and x(2) = f(8) = 21 �� 1 (mod 4), and therefore x(3) = f(21) = 10946 �� 2 (mod 4).
